item.title: Computationally Checking if a Reaction Network is Monotone or Non-expansive
item.description: arXiv:2409.12487v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We describe a procedure for testing for non-expansivity and monotonicity of reaction networks. We demonstrate how this procedure can be used to generate explicit norms for which a reaction network is non-expansive, cones for which the system is monotone, or to prove no such objects exist. We demonstrate how this procedure recovers past results, generates new ones, as well as proves that certain reaction networks will not be monotone or non-expansive with respect to any cone or norm. Lastly, we also note a duality relationship for monotone reaction networks.
item.dc:creator: Alon Duvall
